source_id: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_007_chunk18
evidence_span: The Nuclear Safety Research Reactor (NSRR) is a modified TRIGA Annular Core Pulse Reactor. Its main salient features are its large pulsing power capability that allows the $1 0 ~ \%$ enriched fuel to be heated by nuclear fission to temperatures above the melting point of $\mathrm { U O } _ { 2 }$

source_id: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_007_chunk18
evidence_span: The NSRR core consists of 149 driver uranium-zirconium hydride fuel/moderator elements

source_id: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_007_chunk18
evidence_span: During the maximum reactivity insertion of $3 . 4 ~ \% ~ \Delta k / k ~ ( \mathbb { S } 4 . 6 7 )$ , the pulse power reaches 21.1 GW with a corresponding core energy release (integrated reactor power) of 117 MJ with a minimum reactor period of $1 . 1 7 ~ \mathrm { m s }$

source_id: STP1597-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_18th Volume_007_chunk18
evidence_span: During the maximum reactivity insertion of $3 . 4 ~ \% ~ \Delta k / k ~ ( \mathbb { S } 4 . 6 7 )$ , the pulse power reaches 21.1 GW with a corresponding core energy release (integrated reactor power) of 117 MJ with a minimum reactor period of $1 . 1 7 ~ \mathrm { m s }$
